lexUnit.name: paved.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: covered with stones or asphalt

sentence.text: Summer chrysanthemums provide a cheerful border for the paved area
Begonias are particular favourites and a gaggle of them gather on the paved area near the front door resplendent in pink , scarlet and yellow .
The lower school had its own grassed and paved play area with plentiful equipment .
There was an open roll-top desk facing one of the wide windows and , to its right , a stable door , the top half open , gave a view of the paved courtyard .
Set in a paved courtyard , the Hotel Villa Delle Rose is a small , friendly property of traditional character .
Patio doors lead out from the house onto the sweeping lines of a brick paved terrace , the latter providing ample room for sitting and dining .
The kitchen , quarry-tiled , looked out onto a courtyard paved in red brick with various evergreen shrubs in tubs .
` People still do believe the myth that the streets of London are paved in gold , " said Chris Kemp , chairman of Community Campus .
We created an attractive and useful patio area paved with wooden decking and surrounded by planting towards the lower end of the garden .
Here where the streets are not paved with gold , but with garbage .
THE road to Celtic Park was paved with punters .
He was standing in a square paved with dark-grey stone .
The surface was paved with massive stones and on these watery foundations Venice was built -- a floating city !
I saw a king 's hall paved with marble , and pillared with silver and gold , where no servants waited , but where the lamps and tapers burned with scented smoke , bright as day
The floor was paved with marble flagstones , black and white so it looked like a chessboard , and on this had been laid the thickest rugs from Persia , India and Turkey .
The main roads within the city gates are paved with dark local stone and have pavements and kerbstones .
The gate opened into a magnificent courtyard paved with huge slabs of stone , an enchanted place of moonlit trees and silvered statuary .
